_header: God hath granted grace unto our learning
Note:
‘Each stanza begins with a proverb or precept in Latin which the text expounds upon or explains’ (Louis (1992)
XLouis, Cameron. “Proverbs, Precepts, and Monitory Pieces.” A Manual of the Writings of Middle English. Albert E. Hartung Vol. 9, fascicle 22. New Haven, CT: Connecticut Academy of Arts and Sciences, 1993; ed. Hartung et. al, 2981).
Title(s): ‘De concordia inter rectores fratres et rectores ecclesie’
_description: ‘De concordia inter rectores fratres et rectores ecclesie’, by John Audelay — seventy-eight 13-line stanzas

BodDou302.First Lines:
God haþ grauntyd grace vnto oure lerny[n]gAl þat we
                    fynden fayfully wrytyn in hele wryt…
BodDou302.Last Lines:
…ffor at a fole ȝe may lereȝif ȝe wil take
                    hede
BodDou302.Note: Ends imperfectly due to loss of folios.
BodDou302.Attributed Title:
De concordia inter rectores fratres et rectores ecclesie (f.
                        2rb)
